name: bastardized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is bastardized, it has been changed in such a way that it no longer represents the values and qualities that it is intended to represent: a bastardized form of the word/language The house was badly altered and so bastardized that it no longer reflected the architect’s style. See
bastardize
More examplesFewer examplesSome experts say the restored film is a bastardized version.I made a bastardized version of a seafood marinara using tinned tuna.Two members of the band left, but the others tried to keep it going in a fairly bastardized form. The Tiffany glass lamp has been bastardized into plastic lamps in chain restaurants engulfed by potted ferns.
